result.execSummary:
The defendant Earnestine Ghoston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all court costs, surcharges.  To be paid from 25% of prison accounts under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining  due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all apropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that her voting priviletges aer suspended during the length of this sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Failure to Act/Sexual Assault of Child

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earnestine Ghoston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (12 pages) commencing 01-15-2015, SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Candice G.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26177416 in court 1x on 01-12-2015

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Co-defendant Clipps resolved matter earlier this week.
The court will now enter Judgment of Conviction as to count 3 and orders count 4 DISMISSED and read in.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 60 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 342 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 24 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison accounts under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 1/12/15 for Candice G. for 1 appearance on 1/12/15.
Atty Jones is requesting an adjournment of the sentencing date due to family situtation.  The state has no objection to adjournment to after the trial date of co-defendant (1-12-2015).
Defense Motion to Adjourn Sentencing on 11-13-2014 filed.

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter was set for jury trial today.  Defendant wishes to resolve short of trial.
Counsels are requesting that the court accept the plea as to count 3 but WITHHOLD entry of judgment of conviction and dismissal of count 4 until after the debriefing has been completed.
As to count 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
As to count 4:  Court will order the count to be dismissed and read in at the next court appearance.
Case is adjourned to 11-13-2014 at 8:15 am.  Defendant is remanded.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Earnestine Ghoston not in court, in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense will be prepared to proceed to trial on 10-13-2014.
State has filed Proposed Redactions of the Forensic Interview and Supplemental Witness List and adds additional witness of Sara McLaughlin

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Earnestine Ghoston not in court, in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Jones was just appointed and has not received discovery from prior counsel.
Atty Jones is available for the previously set dates of 9-12-14 final pretrial and 10-13-14 jury trial.
Counsel will contact Atty Scott Anderson(counsel for co-deft) to determine if there is a severance issue.

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to withdraw is granted by the Court.  Counsel is moving out of state.  Public defender office to be advised that new counsel is to be available for the set dates of 9-12-2014 and 10-13-2014 for jury trial.  Case set for 7-23-2014 for status.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel of Record

Atty McCune contacts the court to request date for motion to withdraw as counsel (moving out of state).  Motion is set for 7-14-2014 at 8:15.  ADA Falk to be notified. Defendant to be produced from CJF.

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing held. For reasons stated on the record the Court grants the :
State's motion to introduce evidence of illegal drug use expert testimony.
State's motion to introduce expert testimony.
Defense motion for adjournment of jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for 07/14/2014 vacated.
  
The Court is provided with a recorded copy of the victim interview.  Court orders parties to submit redactions of the recording by 08/28/2014.  Case remains calendared in Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties met in chambers.  Case is adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 38.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Letter from Atty McClune stating he will join with motions filed 6-4-2014 by co-counsel as to Motion Barring Expert Testimony of Liz Ghilardi and Motion Limiting Expert Testimony of Michael Scahill.
Filed by the State:  Notice of Intent to Introduce Expert RN Testimony, Summary of Expert's Testimony, List of Witnesses

Attorney Scott Mcclune in court, defendant Earnestine Ghoston not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State has presented the last portion of discovery to defense counsel.  Atty Anderson has not had the chance to respond to State's motion to Introduce Illegal Drug Use and the State has not had the chance to review briefs filed by Atty McClune.  The Court will adjourn matter to 6-30-2014 for final pretrial and motions,  Jury trial date of 7-14-2014 to stand.
Filed by defense:  Witness List, Proposed Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine
Defendant's Response to State's Notice of Intent to Use Videotaped Statements and to Introduce Evidence of Illegal Drug Use, filed.
DEFENDANT'S RESPONSE TO STATE'S NOTICE OF INTENT TO USE VIDEOTAPED STATEMENTS AND TO INTRODUCE EVIDENCE OF ILLEGAL DRUG USE
from defendant, filed.

Filed:  State's Notice of Intent to Use Videotaped Statements at Jury Trial pursuant to 908.08, Stats

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion for severance from 14CF578 is heard and DENIED.
The State is not intending to introduce either of the statements made by defendants.
State's offer is placed on the record.  Defendant rejects the offer.
Case remains in trial posture.  Next date of final pretrial to stand and trial date of 7-14-2014.
to Sever Defendant's filed.

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Scott Ryan McClune.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel will be filing motion for severance with 14CF578 due to antagonistic defense.  State will be requesting that cases proceed on same date with dual jury panels.
Case set for final pretrial on 6-13-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-14-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed within 17 days of today.   Motion to sever to be heard on 4-3-2014.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing FEBRUARY 19, 2014  received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Scott McClune - SPD Appointment  1746 S Muskego Avenue  Milwaukee, WI  53204.

ADA Miriam Falk is requesting a new date for arraignment/bail hearing as she will be out of town on 3-3-2014.  ADA Falk has contact defense counsel and the new agreed upon date is 3-10-2014 at 8:15.  State to send confirming letter to court and counsels.

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Scott Ryan McClune.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sarah Blomme-MPD Detective,  Angela Phillips-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.G., her residence or school as well as Charles Clipps (co-defendant).

Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Earnestine Ghoston in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
